cooking_method: 1. In a bowl, whisk together buttermilk, garlic powder, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
2. Add chicken thighs and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
3. Preheat oven to 250°F.
4. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
5. Remove chicken from buttermilk mixture and dredge in flour.
6. Fry chicken for 5-6 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through.
7. Drain on paper towels and transfer to a baking sheet.
8. Keep chicken warm in the oven while you cook the waffles according to package instructions.
9. Serve chicken on top of waffles and drizzle with maple syrup.
1. Preheat grill or grill pan to high heat.
2. In a bowl, combine ground beef, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and black pepper.
3. Divide the meat into 4 equal portions and shape them into patties.
4. Grill the burgers for 3-4 minutes on each side or until desired doneness.
5. In a small bowl, combine ketchup, mayonnaise, and yellow mustard to make the burger sauce.
6. Toast the buns on the grill for 30 seconds to 1 minute, until lightly charred.
7. Assemble the burgers by placing a patty on the bottom bun, followed by a slice of cheese, lettuce, tomato, bacon (optional), and burger sauce.
8. Top with the other half of the bun and serve immediately.
1. Preheat the oven to 450°F.
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. Add the cubed butter and use your fingertips or a pastry cutter to work the butter into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Add the buttermilk and stir just until the dough comes together.
5. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead briefly, just until the dough is smooth.
6. Roll out the dough to a 1/2-inch thickness and use a biscuit cutter to cut out rounds.
7. Place the rounds on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the biscuits are golden brown.
9. Serve warm with butter and jam, if desired.
1. Preheat grill to high heat.
2. In a food processor, pulse parsley, cilantro, garlic, red wine vinegar, olive oil, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
3. Brush both sides of the steaks with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
4. Place the steaks on the grill and cook for 4-5 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
5. Remove the steaks from the grill and let rest for 5 minutes.
6. Slice the steaks against the grain and serve with chimichurri sauce.
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F.
2. Cook the macaroni according to package directions.
3. Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy, then crumble it.
4. In a separate large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and whisk for 2-3 minutes until the mixture is smooth.
5. Add the milk, salt, and pepper, and whisk until the mixture thickens, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the shredded cheddar cheese and stir until it is melted and the mixture is smooth.
7. Drain the macaroni and add it to the cheese sauce. Add the crumbled bacon and stir to combine.
8. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and sprinkle the breadcrumbs on top.
9. Bake for 25-30 minutes until the top is golden brown and the mac and cheese is bubbly.
1. In a large pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
2. Add the onion and celery and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Stir in the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes.
4. Add the potatoes, half-and-half, salt, black pepper, and thyme.
5. Bring to a simmer and cook until the potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes.
6. Stir in the clams and cook for an additional 5 minutes, until the clams are heated through.
7. Serve hot with oyster crackers.
1. In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
2. Add the steak, green bell pepper, onion, and mushrooms to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper and cook until the steak is browned and the vegetables are softened, about 10 minutes.

3. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Split the hoagie rolls and place them on a baking sheet. Add two slices of provolone cheese to each roll. Toast the rolls in the oven until the cheese is melted and the bread is toasted, about 5 minutes.
4. Once the rolls are toasted, spoon the steak and vegetable mixture onto the rolls. Serve immediately.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cooking_method: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine shredded chicken and buffalo sauce.
3. In another mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, ranch dressing, blue cheese crumbles, green onions, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper until smooth.
4. Add chicken mixture to the cream cheese mixture and stir until well combined.
5. Transfer mixture to an oven-safe baking dish.
6. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.
7. Serve with tortilla chips.
1. In a bowl, mix together BBQ sauce, apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and black pepper.
2. Rub mixture all over pork shoulder roast and place in slow cooker.
3. Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours or high for 4-6 hours, until pork is tender and falls apart easily with a fork.
4. Remove pork from slow cooker and shred with two forks. Return pork to slow cooker and toss with remaining sauce.
5. Serve hot on buns with additional BBQ sauce and toppings of your choice.
1. In a large bowl, whisk together buttermilk and hot sauce.
2. Add chicken pieces and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to overnight.
3. In a shallow dish, whisk together flour, garlic powder, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
4. Remove chicken from buttermilk mixture and dredge in flour mixture, shaking off excess.
5. In a large skillet, heat enough vegetable oil to come about 1/2 inch up the sides over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking.
6. Add chicken pieces and fry, turning occasionally, until golden brown and cooked through, about 12-15 minutes for drumsticks and 15-18 minutes for thighs.
7. Remove chicken from skillet and drain on paper towels.
8. Serve hot with your favorite sides.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cooking_method: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cook elbow macaroni according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
3. In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour until smooth.
4. Gradually add whole milk, whisking constantly, until mixture is smooth.
5. Cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
6. Remove from heat and stir in cheddar and Gruyere cheese until melted and smooth.
7. Add garlic powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper to taste.
8. Stir cooked elbow macaroni into the cheese sauce until well combined.
9. Transfer mixture to a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over the top.
10. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until top is golden brown and bubbly.
11. Serve hot.
1. Mix smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper together in a small bowl.
2. Rub spice mixture all over the pork shoulder.
3. In a separate bowl, mix BBQ sauce, apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, ketchup, honey, Worcestershire sauce, and Dijon mustard together.
4. Pour BBQ sauce mixture over the pork shoulder and place in a slow cooker.
5. Cook on low for 8-10 hours, or until pork is tender and falls apart easily.
6. Shred pork with two forks and mix with the remaining sauce in the slow cooker.
7. Serve hot on hamburger buns.
1. Preheat oven to 400°F.
2. In a large bowl, toss baby potatoes, asparagus, and red bell pepper with olive oil, dried thyme, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread vegetables on a large sheet pan.
4. Place salmon fillets on top of the vegetables.
5. Season salmon with salt and pepper.
6. Bake for 15-20 minutes, until salmon is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
7. Serve hot with lemon wedges.
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Cook macaroni according to package instructions, drain and set aside.
3. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter.
4. Whisk in flour and cook for 2 minutes until lightly browned.
5. Gradually whisk in milk and heavy cream, stirring constantly until mixture thickens.
6. Stir in salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
7. Add shredded cheese and stir until melted and smooth.
8. Add cooked macaroni to the cheese sauce and stir to coat evenly.
9. Pour mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish and sprinkle with breadcrumbs.
10. Bake for 30-35 minutes until golden brown and bubbly.
11. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cooking_method: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F.
2. Place salmon fillet in a baking dish.
3. In a small bowl, mix garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, melted butter, salt, and black pepper. Pour the mixture over the salmon fillet.
4. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
5. Serve hot with fresh parsley.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, mix together olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
Brush chicken with spice mixture and grill for 5-7 minutes per side or until cooked through.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes and then slice into strips.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, blue cheese, red onion, and sliced almonds.
Top with sliced chicken and drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette.

ingredients: 1 pound sirloin steak, cut into small pieces
cooking_method: 1. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter.
2. Add steak bites and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until browned.
3. Add garlic, dried thyme, salt, and black pepper. Cook for an additional minute.
4. Remove from heat and garnish with fresh parsley.
5. Serve hot with your favorite sides.

ingredients: Lemon wedges and fresh parsley, for serving
cooking_method: 1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, honey, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
3. Brush the mixture onto the salmon fillets.
4. Grill the salmon for 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
5. Serve hot with lemon wedges and fresh parsley.

ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced
Tortillas, shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa for serving
cooking_method: 1. In a slow cooker, add sliced chicken, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, onion, garlic, chili powder, ground cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper.
2. Pour chicken broth over the top and stir to combine.
3. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 3-4 hours.
4. Serve with warm tortillas, shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cooking_method: 1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
2. Brush salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt and black pepper.
3. Grill salmon fillets for 5-7 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your liking.
4. In a medium bowl, combine diced avocado, red onion, cilantro, lime juice, honey, and olive oil. Stir to combine.
5. Top grilled salmon fillets with avocado salsa and serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 pound beef sirloin steak, sliced into thin strips
Salt and black pepper to taste
cooking_method: 1. Season beef strips with salt and black pepper, and coat with flour.
2. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add olive oil and brown the beef strips on all sides. Remove from skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, melt butter and sauté onion and garlic until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
4. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
5. Stir in condensed beef broth and Worcestershire sauce, and bring to a boil.
6. Reduce heat to low and add the beef strips back to the skillet. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
7. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
8. Serve hot over cooked egg noodles, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cooking_method: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together Dijon mustard, honey, mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
3. Place chicken breasts in a baking dish and spread honey mustard mixture evenly over the top.
4. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the middle.
5. Serve hot with fresh parsley on top.

ingredients: 1 can (14.5 ounces) black beans, drained and rinsed
Salt and black pepper to taste
Shredded cheese, sour cream, and fresh cilantro, for serving
cooking_method: 1. In a slow cooker, combine chicken, diced tomatoes, black beans, enchilada sauce, green chilies, onion, garlic, chicken broth, cumin, and chili powder.
2. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours, or until chicken is cooked through and tender.
3. Remove chicken from the slow cooker and shred it using two forks. Return the chicken to the slow cooker and stir to combine.
4. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
5. Serve hot with shredded cheese, sour cream, and fresh cilantro on top.
1. Preheat oven to 425°F.
2. Rinse chicken and pat dry. Rub chicken with 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper.
3. In a large bowl, toss potatoes, carrots, brussels sprouts, lemon, onion, remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper.
4. Arrange vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet. Place chicken on top of the vegetables.
5. Roast for 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
6. Let chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving. Serve chicken and vegetables together.

recipe_name: Black Bean and Sweet Potato Chili
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) black beans, drained and rinsed
Salt and black pepper to taste
cooking_method: 1. In a large pot over medium heat, add olive oil, onion, and garlic. Cook until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
2. Add sweet potatoes and red bell pepper and cook for another 5 minutes.
3. Add black beans, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, chili powder, and cumin. Bring to a boil.
4. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until sweet potatoes are tender.
5. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
6. Serve hot with your favorite toppings, such as avocado, shredded cheese, or sour cream.

ingredients: 2 pounds beef chuck roast, cut into 1-inch cubes
cooking_method: 1. In a small bowl, whisk together the beef broth and flour until smooth.
2. In a 6-quart slow cooker, add the beef, garlic, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, paprika, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine.
3. Add the chopped carrots, potatoes, and onion to the slow cooker and stir to combine.
4. Pour the beef broth mixture over the ingredients in the slow cooker and stir to combine.
5. Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours or on high for 4-5 hours, or until the beef and vegetables are tender.
6. Add the frozen peas to the slow cooker and stir to combine.
7. Cover and cook for an additional 10-15 minutes until the peas are heated through.
8. Sprinkle with chopped parsley before serving.
1. In a medium bowl, mix together the cornstarch and black pepper. Add the sliced flank steak and toss to coat.
2. In another small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, and beef broth.
3. In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over high heat. Add the minced garlic and grated ginger and stir-fry for 1 minute.
4. Add the sliced flank steak and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until browned.
5. Add the broccoli florets and sliced mushrooms and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
6. Pour in the sauce mixture and stir to coat the beef and vegetables.
7. Cook for another 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the beef is cooked through.
8. Serve hot over rice or noodles.
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a shallow bowl, mix together the breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, basil, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
3. Place the beaten eggs in another shallow bowl.
4. Coat each chicken breast in flour, then dip in the egg mixture, and finally coat in the breadcrumb mixture.
5. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the coating is crispy and golden brown.

ingredients: 2 cans (15 ounces each) black beans, drained and rinsed
cooking_method: 1. In a large bowl, mash the black beans with a fork or potato masher.
2. Add the breadcrumbs, cilantro, red onion, garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
3. Divide the mixture into 4-6 portions and shape into patties.
4. Coat the patties with flour, shaking off any excess.
5. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat the vegetable oil.
6. Cook the patties until browned and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per side.
7. Serve the burgers on buns with your favorite toppings.

ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced
Salt and black pepper to taste
cooking_method: 1. Cook the linguine according to the package instructions.
2. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the chicken until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the sliced mushrooms and garlic and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
4. Add the chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly reduced.
5. Add the heavy cream and Parmesan cheese, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens.
6. Return the chicken to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Add the cooked linguine to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
8. Season with salt and black pepper to taste and serve hot.
